Description:
This story sets up the initial project structure, dependencies, configuration files, and the initial database schema for the gym social network MVP. This foundational setup will enable subsequent stories to build upon a stable and well-configured environment.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* Project dependencies are defined in `package.json`
* TypeScript configuration is set up in `tsconfig.json`
* Environment variables are defined in `.env`
* Application entry point is created in `src/index.ts`
* Database connection configuration is set up in `src/config/database.ts`
* Type definitions for the database schema are defined in `src/models/index.ts`
* Root layout component is created in `src/layouts/RootLayout.tsx`
* Global styles are defined in `src/styles/globals.css`


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 1
*ID:* STORY-001

This story configures Supabase for user authentication with email/password and social login options. It sets up the necessary infrastructure for secure user sign-up, login, and session management, which is essential for user onboarding and interaction within the gym social network.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 2
*ID:* STORY-002

This story defines and creates the database schema for user profiles, fitness goals, workout logs, and challenge data. This foundational setup is critical for storing and managing user data, which will be used to generate personalized challenges and track user progress.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* User Profiles table created with required fields
* Fitness Goals table created with required fields
* Workout Logs table created with required fields
* Challenges table created with required fields
* Database schema applied successfully


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 3
*ID:* STORY-003

Implement the user onboarding process, allowing users to create accounts and input personal fitness goals and gym habits. This process establishes the baseline for personalization, which is required for generating relevant challenges.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 4
*ID:* STORY-004

Provide a simple, efficient interface for users to manually input completed workouts including exercises, sets, reps, weight, and notes. This functionality is crucial for feeding real-world data into the challenge engine, ensuring that challenges are grounded in actual user behavior.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 5
*ID:* STORY-005

Develop the logic for generating tailored workout challenges based on user goals, history, and preferences. This functionality is core to the product's unique value proposition, ensuring that users receive creative and motivating challenges that align with their fitness journey.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 6
*ID:* STORY-006

This story creates a dashboard where users can view active challenges, track their progress, and visualize their completion streaks. The dashboard aims to maintain user motivation by providing clear visibility into their current challenges and progress.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 7
*ID:* STORY-007

Set up non-intrusive updates on challenge progress, upcoming challenges, and streak reminders through push notifications or daily digests. This functionality will help users stay engaged with the platform without requiring constant real-time interaction.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 8
*ID:* STORY-008

Ensure fast loading times and a smooth user experience for gym environment usage by optimizing performance. This includes optimizing asset loading, minimizing render-blocking resources, and leveraging a global CDN for faster content delivery.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* All screens load in under 2 seconds on a 3G connection
* Implement lazy loading for images and videos
* Minimize and compress CSS and JavaScript files
* Use a service worker for caching static assets
* Ensure that all critical rendering paths are optimized


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 9
*ID:* STORY-009

This story focuses on ensuring the security and privacy of user data within the gym social network application. It involves implementing secure authentication, encrypted storage, and access controls to protect sensitive information and maintain user trust.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* Implement secure authentication using Supabase Auth with email/password and social login options.
* Ensure all user data is encrypted at rest using AES-256 encryption.
* Ensure all data transmitted between the client and server is encrypted using TLS 1.3.
* Implement role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict data access based on user roles.
* Conduct a security audit and penetration testing to identify and mitigate potential vulnerabilities.


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 10
*ID:* STORY-010

This story ensures that the application is usable by people with diverse abilities by implementing WCAG 2.1 AA compliance for all UI elements. This includes proper use of ARIA roles, keyboard navigability, color contrast, and text resizing.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* All UI elements have appropriate ARIA roles and attributes.
* The application is fully navigable using a keyboard.
* All text has sufficient color contrast ratios.
* Text can be resized up to 200% without loss of content or functionality.
* Forms have proper labels and instructions.
* Images have descriptive alt text.
* Videos have captions and transcripts.
* The application passes automated accessibility testing tools.


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 11
*ID:* STORY-011

This story configures Vercel for hosting and deployment of the frontend and backend of the gym social network application. Vercel will be used to deploy the Next.js frontend and serverless functions for the backend API. This setup ensures a scalable, performant, and globally available application.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 12
*ID:* STORY-012

This story sets up the integration with Resend to handle transactional emails and push notifications for the gym social network MVP. Resend will be used to send notifications such as challenge reminders, streak celebrations, and daily digests to keep users engaged and motivated.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 13
*ID:* STORY-013

Implement Supabase's real-time capabilities to provide live updates on challenge tracking and user progress. This feature will enhance user engagement by ensuring that users receive immediate feedback on their challenge progress without needing to refresh the page.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 14
*ID:* STORY-014

This story focuses on implementing robust input validation rules and duplicate prevention constraints within the Supabase database schema to ensure data integrity. This is crucial for maintaining the accuracy of user profiles, fitness goals, workout logs, and challenge data. By enforcing strict validation and preventing duplicates, we can ensure that the challenge engine and user progress tracking remain reliable and relevant.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 15
*ID:* STORY-015

This story establishes the foundational structure and styles for the web application. It includes creating the root layout, app shell, and global styles that will be used throughout the application. This setup ensures a consistent look and feel and provides a starting point for all subsequent UI components.

h3. Acceptance Criteria
* Root layout component is created and correctly wraps all pages.
* Global styles file is created and includes base styles for typography, colors, and spacing.
* App shell component is created and includes navigation and other persistent elements.


----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 16
*ID:* STORY-016

Implement authentication middleware to protect routes and APIs, ensuring that only authenticated users can access certain parts of the application. This includes setting up middleware to check for valid authentication tokens, handling session management, and protecting specific routes.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 17
*ID:* STORY-017

This story sets up database access control using Row Level Security (RLS) policies or equivalent mechanisms to ensure that users can only access their own data. This is crucial for maintaining data privacy and integrity within the gym social network.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 18
*ID:* STORY-018

This story aims to implement schema validation for all user inputs to ensure data integrity and prevent invalid data from being stored in the database. This includes validation for user profiles, fitness goals, workout logs, and challenge data.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 19
*ID:* STORY-019

This story focuses on creating the dashboard or landing page that users will see after logging in. The dashboard will serve as the central hub where users can view their active challenges, track progress, and interact with the community. It will provide a clear overview of the user's current status and available actions.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 20
*ID:* STORY-020

This story focuses on setting up environment configurations and production deployment for the gym social network application. This includes defining environment variables, build commands, and health checks necessary for a smooth deployment on Vercel. The goal is to ensure that the application can be deployed efficiently and is ready for production use.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 21
*ID:* STORY-021

This story outlines the combined CRUD operations for managing user data within the gym social network. It includes creating, reading, updating, and deleting user profiles, fitness goals, and workout logs. These operations are essential for maintaining accurate user data, enabling personalized challenges, and ensuring a seamless user experience.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 22
*ID:* STORY-022

This story focuses on developing the user interface pages and components for the gym social network application. This includes creating the layout, navigation, forms, and other UI elements necessary for users to interact with the system effectively. The goal is to provide a seamless and engaging user experience that supports the core functionality of the application.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 23
*ID:* STORY-023

This story implements real-time subscriptions for live updates on challenge tracking and user progress using Supabase's real-time capabilities. It also handles reconnection logic to ensure users receive updates even if their connection is temporarily lost.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 24
*ID:* STORY-024

This story combines all core user flows from the MVP scope, ensuring a seamless user experience from onboarding to challenge completion and tracking. It integrates the capabilities implemented in STORY-004, STORY-005, STORY-006, STORY-007, and STORY-008 to create a cohesive user journey.

----
*Layer:* Features
*Order:* 25
*ID:* STORY-025
